momMetaData.momTitle: Managed Object Model for CP File System Management Function

mim.author: Akhila Giramoni
mim.name: AxeCpFileSystem
mim.description: CP File System Management function MOM.

derivedDataType.name: DeleteFileTimer
derivedDataType.description: Specifies the delay in minutes for deletion of subfile.

class.name: CpFileSystemM
class.description:
Represents the root MOC for AXE CP File System Management function MOM. The function provides file management and file processing services for CP applications requiring APG support. It implements the CP file system which is based on AP file system, supporting the different file classes and file types used in the CP.
Two different CP file classes, which indicate the structure of the file, are supported: 1) Simple: A CP simple file only contains data, and is not a part of a composite file. 2) Composite: A CP composite file is made up of a main file and any number of subfiles. The main file is a template for the creation of the subfiles. The subfiles contain the data records.
Two different file types, which indicate how the records in a file are accessed, are supported: 1) Regular: A regular file contains records that may be written or read sequentially or by addressing specific record numbers. 2) Infinite: An infinite file is a composite file where the subfiles are automatically created by the system. An infinite file may be read or written sequentially. When writing to an infinite file, data is written sequentially to the most recently created subfile, called active subfile.
Infinite subfiles in the CP file system may be transfered automatically to a remote side, if the infinite main file has been defined to a data transfer policy.
CP handles file and volume names as case insensitive strings, so two file or volume names can not differ in meaning based on differing use of uppercase and lowercase letters. It is advisable, to avoid misunderstandings, define file and volume names always in uppercase.
A CP File is unique in the CP File System. It means that it is not possible to create, in the same or different CP Volumes, two or more CP Files with the same name.

action.name: importCpFile
action.description:
Imports a file or a directory stored on APG file system to an existing CP file. It is applicable on a Single-CP System configuration. A compressed file can be imported as well. A compressed file or a directory can be imported only in an existing composite CP file. Importing is done taking data from the predefined folder "cp/files".
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Access error: The requested operation conflicts with other user of the file. - Action not executed, AP backup in progress: A backup operation is ongoing. - File exists: <CP file name>: The CP file already exists in the CP file system. - File was not found: <CP file name>: The CP file was not found in the CP file system. - General Fault: Error when executing. - Invalid file name: The CP file name is not correct. - Invalid file reference: Attempt to import an AP file or directory containing incorrect file names to a CP composite file. - Invalid path: The path to import from is invalid. - Not allowed in this system configuration: The action is not allowed in Multi-CP System. - Operation not permitted for this file type: The requested operation is not allowed for CP infinite file. - Physical file error: <detailed information>: An error has occured in the AP file system.

parameter.name: source
parameter.description: Specifies the name of a file system item, file or folder, to import in a CP file. The string should be expressed as: [<FolderPathName>/]<ItemName>. "FolderPathName" is optional since it represents the relative path respect to predefined folder "cp/files". "ItemName" is the name of a file or a folder. For example if the file "cp/files/CpDump/AXEdump" should be imported in a CP file, the parameter "source" should be "CpDump/AXEdump".

parameter.name: destCpFile
parameter.description: Specifies the name of CP file which to act the import into.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.description:
Specifies the import mode.
It can be one of the following values:
OVERWRITE: An existing CP file is overwritten.
APPEND: Data is added to the end of an existing CP file.
NORMAL: Import fails in case the name of the file system item being imported is the same of an already existing destination CP file.
CLEAR: An existing CP file is overwritten. If the destination is a composite CP file, all subfiles belonging to it are deleted before starting import.

action.name: exportCpFile
action.description:
Exports a CP file to the APG file system in a Single-CP System configuration. Exporting a CP composite file means exporting a folder, representing it, and all included files. Exporting a CP simple file or a CP subfile means exporting a single file.
Exporting is done towards the predefined folder "cp/files".
Exported data can be compressed, into zip format, if specified via parameter "toZip".
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Access error: The requested operation conflicts with other user of the file. - Action not executed, AP backup in progress: A backup operation is ongoing. - File is protected. File is connected to a transfer queue: The CP file is connected to a transfer queue and can not be exported. - File was not found: <CP file name>: The CP file was not found in the CP file system. - General Fault: Error when executing. - Invalid file name: The CP file name is not correct. - Invalid path: The path to export is invalid. - Not allowed in this system configuration: The action is not allowed in Multi-CP System. - Parameter error: mode CLEAR not allowed: Export with mode clear is not supported. - Physical file error: <detailed information>: An error has occured in the APG file system.

parameter.name: sourceCpFile
parameter.description: Specifies the name of CP File to export.

parameter.name: dest
parameter.description: Specifies the name of a file system item, file or folder, where to export a CP file. The string should be expressed as: [<FolderPathName>/]<ItemName>. "FolderPathName" is optional since it represents the relative path respect to predefined folder "cp/files". "ItemName" is the name of a file or a folder. For example if a CP file export to file "cp/files/CpDump/AXEdump" is needed, the parameter "dest" should be "CpDump/AXEdump".

parameter.name: mode
parameter.description:
Specifies the export mode.
It can be one of the following values:
OVERWRITE: An existing file system item is overwritten.
APPEND: Data is added to the end of an existing file system item.
NORMAL : Export fails in case the destination path contains a file having the same name as the CP simple file or the CP subfile being exported.
Note: mode CLEAR is not supported.

parameter.name: toZip
parameter.description: Enables or disables creation of a zip archive. The created zip archive is named as specified by the parameter "dest" and its extension is '.zip'.

action.name: copyCpFile
action.description:
Copies a CP file to another CP file. The destination file must already exist.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Access error: The requested operation conflicts with other user of the file. - Action not executed, AP backup in progress: A backup operation is ongoing. - File exists: <CP file name>: The CP file already exists in the CP file system. - File is protected. File is connected to a transfer queue: The CP file is connected to a transfer queue, and can not be copied from or copied to. - File was not found: <CP file name>: The CP file was not found in the CP file system. - General Fault: Error when executing. - Invalid file name: The CP file name is not correct. - Not a composite file: <CP file name>: The requested operation is only allowed for a CP composite file. - Not a simple file or subfile: <CP file name>: The requested operation is only allowed for a CP simple file or subfile. - Not allowed in this system configuration: The action is not allowed in Multi-CP System. - Operation not permitted for this file type: The requested operation is not allowed for CP infinite file. - Physical file error: <detailed information>: An error has occured in the AP file system.

parameter.name: sourceCpFile
parameter.description: Source CP file.

parameter.name: destCpFile
parameter.description: Specifies the destination CP File.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.description:
Specifies the copy mode.
It can be one of the following values:
OVERWRITE: An existing CP file is overwritten when the CP file is copied.
APPEND: Data is added to the end of an existing CP file when the CP file is copied.
CLEAR: An existing CP file is overwritten when a CP file is copied. If the destination CP file is a composite CP file, all subfiles belonging to this CP file are deleted before the source CP file is copied.
NORMAL : Copy fails in case the destination composite CP file has some CP subfiles with the same name of the CP subfiles being copied.

action.name: moveCpFile
action.description:
Moves a CP file to another CP volume in a Single-CP System configuration. If a composite CP file is moved all the subfiles of that file are also moved. The volume to which the file is moved must already exist.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Access error: The requested operation conflicts with other user of the file. - Action not executed, AP backup in progress: A backup operation is ongoing. - Cannot move file to same volume: A CP file cannot be moved to the same volume where it is already stored. - File is protected. File is connected to a transfer queue: The CP file is connected to a transfer queue and can not be moved. - File was not found: <CP file name>: The CP file was not found in the CP file system. - General Fault: Error when executing. - Invalid file name: The CP file name is not correct. - Not allowed in this system configuration: The action is not allowed in Multi-CP System. - Operation not permitted for this file type: The requested operation is not allowed for CP infinite file. - Physical file error: <detailed information>: An error has occured in the AP file system. - Volume was not found: <volume name>: The destination volume does not exist.

parameter.name: sourceCpFile
parameter.description: CP file to move.

parameter.name: volume
parameter.description: Destination volume.

action.name: renameCpFile
action.description:
Renames a CP file or a CP subfile in a Single-CP System configuration. A CP file and a related CP subfile cannot be renamed at the same time. A CP infinite file cannot be renamed if it is associated to a transfer queue.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Access error: The requested operation conflicts with other user of the file. - Action not executed, AP backup in progress: A backup operation is ongoing. - File exists: <CP file name>: The CP file already exists in the CP file system. - File is protected. File is connected to a transfer queue: The CP file is connected to a transfer queue and cannot be renamed. - File was not found: <CP file name>: The CP file was not found in the CP file system. - General Fault: Error when executing. - Invalid file name: The CP file name is not correct. - Not a composite file: <CP file name>: The requested operation is only allowed for a CP composite file. - Not a simple file or a composite file: <CP file name>: A CP file cannot be renamed as a subfile. - Not a subfile: <CP file name>: A subfile cannot be renamed as a CP composite file. - Not allowed in this system configuration: The action is not allowed in Multi-CP System. - Operation not permitted for this file type: The requested operation is not allowed for a subfile of a CP infinite file. - Physical file error: <detailed information>: An error has occured in the AP file system. - Subfile must belong to the same composite file: <CP file name>: The current and new subfiles do not belong to the same CP composite file.

parameter.name: currentName
parameter.description: Specifies the current CP file or subfile name. It is expressed as <CpFileName> in case of renaming of a CP file, or <CpFileName>-<CpSubfileName> in case of renaming of a CP subfile.

parameter.name: newName
parameter.description: Specifies the new CP file or subfile name. It is expressed as <CpFileName> in case of renaming of a CP file, or <CpFileName>-<CpSubfileName> in case of renaming of a CP subfile.

action.name: copyCpClusterFile
action.description:
Copies a CP file to another CP file. The destination file must already exist. The copy mode can be:
Overwrite : An existing CP file is overwritten when the CP file is copied.
Append : Data is added to the end of an existing CP file when the CP file is copied.
Clear : An existing CP file is overwritten when a CP file is copied. If the destination CP file is a composite CP file, all subfiles belonging to this CP file are deleted before the source CP file is copied.
Copies a CP file to another CP file. The destination file must already exist.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Access error: The requested operation conflicts with other user of the file. - Action not executed, AP backup in progress: A backup operation is ongoing. - File exists: <CP file name>: The CP file already exists in the CP file system. - File is protected. File is connected to a transfer queue: The CP file is connected to a transfer queue, and can not be copied from or copied to. - File was not found: <CP file name>: The CP file was not found in the CP file system. - General Fault: Error when executing. - Invalid file name: The CP file name is not correct. - Not a composite file: <CP file name>: The requested operation is only allowed for a CP composite file. - Not a simple file or subfile: <CP file name>: The requested operation is only allowed for a CP simple file or subfile. - Not allowed in this system configuration: The action is not allowed in Single-CP System. - Operation not permitted for this file type: The requested operation is not allowed for CP infinite file. - Physical file error: <detailed information>: An error has occured in the APG file system.

parameter.name: sourceCpFile
parameter.description: Source CP file.

parameter.name: destCpFile
parameter.description: Specifies the destination CP File.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.description:
Specifies the copy mode.
It can be one of the following values:
OVERWRITE: An existing CP file is overwritten when the CP file is copied.
APPEND: Data is added to the end of an existing CP file when the CP file is copied.
CLEAR: An existing CP file is overwritten when a CP file is copied. If the destination CP file is a composite CP file, all subfiles belonging to this CP file are deleted before the source CP file is copied.
NORMAL : Copy fails in case the destination composite CP file has some CP subfiles with the same name of the CP subfiles being copied.

parameter.name: cpName
parameter.description: The default Central Processor (CP) name or literal "CLUSTER". A valid CP name is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of seven characters.

action.name: exportCpClusterFile
action.description:
Exports a CP file to the APG file system in a Multi-CP System configuration. Exporting a CP composite file means exporting a folder, representing it, and all included files. Exporting a CP simple file or a CP subfile means exporting a single file.
Exporting is done towards the predefined folder "cp/files".
Exported data can be compressed, into zip format, if specified via parameter "toZip".
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Access error: The requested operation conflicts with other user of the file. - Action not executed, AP backup in progress: A backup operation is ongoing. - File is protected. File is connected to a transfer queue: The CP file is connected to a transfer queue and can not be exported. - File was not found: <CP file name>: The CP file was not found in the CP file system. - General Fault: Error when executing. - Invalid file name: The CP file name is not correct. - Invalid path: The path to export is invalid. - Not allowed in this system configuration: The action is not allowed in Single-CP System. - Parameter error: mode CLEAR not allowed: Export with mode clear is not supported. - Physical file error: <detailed information>: An error has occured in the APG file system.

parameter.name: sourceCpFile
parameter.description: Specifies the name of CP File to export.

parameter.name: dest
parameter.description: Specifies the name of a file system item, file or folder, where to export a CP file. The string should be expressed as: [<FolderPathName>/]<ItemName>. "FolderPathName" is optional since it represents the relative path respect to predefined folder "cp/files". "ItemName" is the name of a file or a folder. For example if a CP file export to file "cp/files/CpDump/AXEdump" is needed, the parameter "dest" should be "CpDump/AXEdump".

parameter.name: mode
parameter.description:
Specifies the export mode.
It can be one of the following values:
OVERWRITE: An existing file system item is overwritten.
APPEND: Data is added to the end of an existing file system item.
NORMAL : Export fails in case the destination path contains a file having the same name as the CP simple file or the CP subfile being exported.
Note: mode CLEAR is not supported.

parameter.name: toZip
parameter.description: Enables or disables creation of a zip archive. The created zip archive is named as specified by the parameter "dest" and its extension is '.zip'.

parameter.name: cpName
parameter.description: The default Central Processor (CP) name or literal "CLUSTER". A valid CP name is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of seven characters.

action.name: importCpClusterFile
action.description:
Imports a file or a directory stored on APG file system to an existing CP file. It is applicable on a Multi-CP System configuration. A compressed file can be imported as well. A compressed file or a directory can be imported only in an existing composite CP file. Importing is done taking data from the predefined folder "cp/files".
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Access error: The requested operation conflicts with other user of the file. - Action not executed, AP backup in progress: A backup operation is ongoing. - File exists: <CP file name>: The CP file already exists in the CP file system. - File was not found: <CP file name>: The CP file was not found in the CP file system. - General Fault: Error when executing. - Invalid file name: The CP file name is not correct. - Invalid file reference: Attempt to import an AP file or directory containing incorrect file names to a CP composite file. - Invalid path: The path to import from is invalid. - Not allowed in this system configuration: The action is not allowed in Single-CP System. - Operation not permitted for this file type: The requested operation is not allowed for CP infinite file. - Physical file error: <detailed information>: An error has occured in the AP file system.

parameter.name: source
parameter.description: Specifies the name of a file system item, file or folder, to import in a CP file. The string should be expressed as: [<FolderPathName>/]<ItemName>. "FolderPathName" is optional since it represents the relative path respect to predefined folder "cp/files". "ItemName" is the name of a file or a folder. For example if the file "cp/files/CpDump/AXEdump" should be imported in a CP file, the parameter "source" should be "CpDump/AXEdump".

parameter.name: destCpFile
parameter.description: Specifies the name of CP file which to act the import into.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.description:
Specifies the import mode.
It can be one of the following values:
OVERWRITE: An existing CP file is overwritten.
APPEND: Data is added to the end of an existing CP file.
NORMAL: Import fails in case the name of the file system item being imported is the same of an already existing destination CP file.
CLEAR: An existing CP file is overwritten. If the destination is a composite CP file, all subfiles belonging to it are deleted before starting import.

parameter.name: cpName
parameter.description: The default Central Processor (CP) name or literal "CLUSTER". A valid CP name is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of seven characters.

action.name: moveCpClusterFile
action.description:
Moves a CP file to another CP volume in a Multi-CP System configuration. If a composite CP file is moved all the subfiles of that file are also moved. The volume to which the file is moved must already exist.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Access error: The requested operation conflicts with other user of the file. - Action not executed, AP backup in progress: A backup operation is ongoing. - Cannot move file to same volume: A CP file cannot be moved to the same volume where it is already stored. - File is protected. File is connected to a transfer queue: The CP file is connected to a transfer queue and can not be moved. - File was not found: <CP file name>: The CP file was not found in the CP file system. - General Fault: Error when executing. - Invalid file name: The CP file name is not correct. - Not allowed in this system configuration: The action is not allowed in Single-CP System. - Operation not permitted for this file type: The requested operation is not allowed for CP infinite file. - Physical file error: <detailed information>: An error has occured in the AP file system. - Volume was not found: <volume name>: The destination volume does not exist.

parameter.name: sourceCpFile
parameter.description: CP file to move.

parameter.name: volume
parameter.description: Destination volume.

parameter.name: cpName
parameter.description: The default Central Processor (CP) name or literal "CLUSTER". A valid CP name is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of seven characters.

action.name: renameCpClusterFile
action.description:
Renames a CP file in a Multi-CP System configuration. A CP file and a related CP subfile cannot be renamed at the same time. A CP infinite file cannot be renamed if it is associated to a transfer queue.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Access error: The requested operation conflicts with other user of the file. - Action not executed, AP backup in progress: A backup operation is ongoing. - File exists: <CP file name>: The CP file already exists in the CP file system. - File is protected. File is connected to a transfer queue: The CP file is connected to a transfer queue and cannot be renamed. - File was not found: <CP file name>: The CP file was not found in the CP file system. - General Fault: Error when executing. - Invalid file name: The CP file name is not correct. - Not a composite file: <CP file name>: The requested operation is only allowed for a CP composite file. - Not a simple file or a composite file: <CP file name>: A CP file cannot be renamed as a subfile. - Not a subfile: <CP file name>: A subfile cannot be renamed as a CP composite file. - Not allowed in this system configuration: The action is not allowed in Single-CP System. - Operation not permitted for this file type: The requested operation is not allowed for a subfile of a CP infinite file. - Physical file error: <detailed information>: An error has occured in the AP file system. - Subfile must belong to the same composite file: <CP file name>: The current and new subfiles do not belong to the same CP composite file.

parameter.name: currentName
parameter.description: Specifies the current CP file or subfile name. It is expressed as <CpFileName> in case of renaming of a CP file, or <CpFileName>-<CpSubfileName> in case of renaming of a CP subfile.

parameter.name: newName
parameter.description: Specifies the new CP file or subfile name. It is expressed as <CpFileName> in case of renaming of a CP file, or <CpFileName>-<CpSubfileName> in case of renaming of a CP subfile.

parameter.name: cpName
parameter.description: The default Central Processor (CP) name or literal "CLUSTER". A valid CP name is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of seven characters.

attribute.name: cpFileSystemMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: CpVolume
class.description: Instance of this class represents a volume in the CP file system. A CP volume can contain several CP files and subfiles. A CP file or subfile can only belong to one CP volume.

attribute.name: cpVolumeId
attribute.description:
Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is the name of the volume and the CP to which it belongs. A valid value must comply the following rule:
<volumeName>[:<defaultCpName>]
where:
<volumeName> is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of fourteen characters, also the low hyphen symbol can be used. The string must begin with an alphabetic character; it is recommeded to use upper case characters.
<defaultCpName> is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of seven characters. It must be set to the default CP name or literal "CLUSTER". It is mandatory only on Multi-CP System.

class.name: CompositeFile
class.description: Instance of this class represents a CP regular composite file. It consists of a template for the creation of subfile and one or several subfiles.

attribute.name: compositeFileId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is the name of the composite CP file. A valid name is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of twelve characters. The name must start with an alphabetic character.

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.description: The length, in byte, of the data records. A record contains data elements that are treated as a single unit.

attribute.name: exclusiveAccess
attribute.description: Indicates an exclusive read or write access on the CP file.

attribute.name: numOfReaders
attribute.description: The number of current users with read access on the CP file.

attribute.name: numOfWriters
attribute.description: The number of current users with write access on the CP file.

attribute.name: deleteFileTimer
attribute.description:
Specifies the delay in minutes for deletion of the subfile.
When the deleteFileTimer expires, the file is deleted from the APG. If minus one (-1) is specified, no delete FileTimer is defined for the file. Consequently, minus one (-1) is not regarded as an actual deleteFileTimer value. It is instead used to disable the automatic deletion of the file.
In Multi-CP System this attribute is not applicable.
attribute.sideEffects: For lower disk size this attribute may fill up CP File System quota completely. Refer to User Guide File Management for more information.

class.name: SimpleFile
class.description: Instance of this class represents a simple CP file. It consists of a regular data in one data file.

attribute.name: simpleFileId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is the name of the simple CP file. A valid name is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of twelve characters. The name must start with an alphabetic character.

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.description: The length, in byte, of the data records. A record contains data elements that are treated as a single unit.

attribute.name: size
attribute.description: Indicates the size of the CP file, expressed in records.

attribute.name: numOfReaders
attribute.description: The number of current users with read access on the CP file.

attribute.name: numOfWriters
attribute.description: The number of current users with write access on the CP file.

attribute.name: exclusiveAccess
attribute.description: Indicates an exclusive read or write access on the CP file.

class.name: InfiniteFile
class.description: Instance of this class represents a infinite composite CP file. It is a composite file where the subfiles are created automatically by CP applications. For this type of CP file is possible associate a transfer policy.

action.name: releaseSubFile
action.description: Changes the active subfile. Closes the active and opens a new subfile.

attribute.name: lastSubfileSent
attribute.description: Specifies the last subfile transferred.

attribute.name: maxSize
attribute.description: Specifies the maximum number of records that can be written in an Infinite CP subfile.

attribute.name: maxTime
attribute.description: Specifies the maximum length of time between each change of active subfile of the infinite CP file.

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.description: Specifies the length, in byte, of the data records. A record contains data elements that are treated as a single unit.

attribute.name: overrideSubfileClosure
attribute.description: Specifies the release condition for the Infinite CP File. If the release condition is enabled (true) and an Infinite subfile is closed, a new active subfile is created. If the release condition is not enabled (false) and the infinite file is closed and opened again, then the active subfile will remain the same.

attribute.name: activeSubFile
attribute.description: Specifies the number of the active subfile.

attribute.name: infiniteFileId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is the name of the infinite CP file. A valid name is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of twelve characters. The name must start with an alphabetic character.

attribute.name: exclusiveAccess
attribute.description: Specifies an exclusive read or write access on the CP file.

attribute.name: numOfReaders
attribute.description: Specifies the number of current users with read access on the CP file.

attribute.name: numOfWriters
attribute.description: Specifies the number of current users with write access on the CP file.

attribute.name: transferQueue
attribute.description: Specifies the name of the file transfer queue. It will be used to transfer the infinite CP file to a remote destination.

attribute.name: activeSubfileExclusiveAccess
attribute.description: Specifies an exclusive read or write access on the active infinite subfile.

attribute.name: activeSubfileNumOfReaders
attribute.description: Specifies the number of current users with read access on the active infinte subfile.

attribute.name: activeSubfileNumOfWriters
attribute.description: Specifies the number of current users with write access on the active infinite subfile.

attribute.name: activeSubfileSize
attribute.description: Specifies the active infinite subfile size expressed in records.

attribute.name: transferQueueDn
attribute.description: Specifies the DN for the MO representing the TQ used by Infinite File.

class.name: CompositeSubFile
class.description: Instance of this class represents a subfile of a regular composite CP file.

attribute.name: compositeSubFileId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is the name of the composite CP subfile. It consists of two parts, separated by a dash.The first part is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of twelve characters. The optional second part indicates the subfile generation, it can be an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of six characters.

attribute.name: size
attribute.description: Indicates the size of the subfile, expressed in records.

attribute.name: numOfReaders
attribute.description: The number of current users with read access on the CP subfile.

attribute.name: numOfWriters
attribute.description: The number of current users with write access on the CP subfile.

attribute.name: exclusiveAccess
attribute.description: Indicates an exclusive read or write access on the CP subfile.
